ie.ul.davidbeck.linearlightsout

Class LightsOutGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.ul.davidbeck.linearlightsout.LightsOutGame

  • public class LightsOutGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Model class for a linear lights out game. Clicking a button toggles the state of that button and any neighboring buttons. The goal is to make all the buttons match.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • pressedButtonAtIndex

        public boolean pressedButtonAtIndex(int buttonIndex)
        When the user presses a button call this method to update the game then read values to determine the updated game state.
        Parameters:
        buttonIndex - The button that is pressed in the view
        Returns:
        Returns if this press resulted in all the buttons matching

      • checkForWin

        public boolean checkForWin()
        Convenience method that returns if the game is in a win state. See also: Return value of pressedButtonAtIndex
        Returns:
        true if all the button values match

      • setAllValues

        public void setAllValues(int[] newValues)
        Sets the states of the buttons to the given values. This should only be used to recreate a game in progress after a rotation.
        Parameters:
        newValues -

      • getValueAtIndex

        public int getValueAtIndex(int buttonIndex)
        Get the state of a button at index
        Parameters:
        buttonIndex - The button of interest
        Returns:
        A 0 or 1 value to indicate the button state (0 for OFF, 1 for ON)

      • getNumPresses

        public int getNumPresses()
        Get the number of button presses so far in this game
        Returns:
        The number of legal calls to pressedButtonAtIndex

      • setNumPresses

        public void setNumPresses(int numPresses)
        Sets the number of button presses so far in this game. This should only be used to recreate a game in progress after a rotation.
